body.p: DITA-OT Projects allow you to publish multiple deliverables at once. Each deliverable specifies a reusable source context that groups the maps or topics you want to publish, an output folder, and a publication format (such as HTML, or PDF) with transformation parameters.
For more information about DITA-OT Projects, see the official DITA-OT documentation.
In , DITA-OT Projects can be used to define DITA Contexts (specified by the pair of the source DITA map and an optional filter). The DITA Context can specified directly in the DITA Map pane.
Click the settings button () at the top-right corner of the pane to open the Configure DITA Context dialog box where you can specify the DITA-OT project file and context defined within it.
This dialog box contains the following options:

dlentry.dd: Select this option if you want to specify a DITA-OT project file and optionally, a context defined within it.
Select this option if you want to specify a DITA map and optionally, a DITAVAL filtering file.
If selected, content that is excluded by a DITAVAL context filter is shown as grayed out. If not selected, the excluded content is hidden.

p.note: When opening a DITA map with the referenced topic content expanded and editable in one document while in a concurrent editing session, the DITA Project and DITA Map options are disabled, and thus a DITA context cannot be selected.
